critique: This executive order establishes a commission to organize a White House Small Business Conference. It aims to foster small business and expand opportunities for entry into small business enterprises. There's no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. It seems to expand executive power slightly by creating a commission, but it also delegates some functions to the Administrator of the Small Business Administration. It could be seen as promoting economic intervention by supporting small businesses, and it doesn't directly address social inclusion or conformity.
